content: 14 ~ 54 yards total cup = ~37 yards handle = ~10 yards round 3 the back loop of the first stitch of this round ball = ~7 yards work this round in the front loops only 3 50 mm / e hook single_crochet increase around 21 fiberfil stuffing for the handle and ball yarn needle to weave in end optional small weight for the ball see notes above the 14 free unused back loops of round 2 will be used later in round 21 gauge is not crucial round 4 single_crochet in 2 increase around 28 10 sts / 10 row = 2 5 1 cm rnds 1 3 in pattern = ~1 75 ~4 4 cm round 5 single_crochet in 3 increase around 35 finished size cup and handle ~ 5 5 14 cm tall ball ~ 1 5 3 8 cm diameter round 6 increase in the first st single_crochet around 36 skill level fairly easy rnds 7-19 single_crochet around 13 rounds of 36 single_crochet abbreviations ~ = about chain = chain note decreases for round 20 can be made in the front loops of the fo = fasten_off stitches but it is not essential decrease = decrease / single_crochet 2 sts together j-decrease = joining decrease using the front loops for a decrease produces a less bulky stitch j-single_crochet = joining single_crochet increase = increase / 2 single crochets in one stitch round 20 single_crochet decrease around 24 magic_ring = magic_ring round s = round s single_crochet = single_crochet now it looks something like an elongated doll head photo 1 skip = skip slip_stitch = slip_stitch st s = stitch es push round 1 down inside rounds 13 through 20 smooth the edges so it rests even us terminology it should take the shape of a cup photo 2 rounds 11 and 12 will spiral over the top edge-rim of the cup regarding copyright this is a free pattern for your personal use you are welcome to sell any items that you make but please do not sell the pattern or reproduce the text without permission on the bottom the fourteen free unused loops should be visible and inside the working round photo 3 ****** ****** round 21 is the joining round to connect the 14 unused free back loops of round 2 special joining stitches for this next round first joining decrease j-decrease for round 21 insert the hook through the next stitch round 20 only yarn over and pull up a loop then insert the hook through both the next st of round 20 and then through the stitch the first unused loop of round 2 photo 4 yarn over and pull a loop through both yarn over again and pull through all 3 loops to complete the decrease photo 5 remove the stitch marker from the stitch subsequent joining decreases j-decrease for round 21 ▪ insert the hook through the next stitch round 20 only ▪ yarn over and pull up a loop
